Package grafioschtrader.repository

Interface SecurityJpaRepository

All Superinterfaces:
BaseRepositoryCustom<Security>, org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Security,Integer>, ISecuritycurrencyService<Security>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Security,Integer>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaSpecificationExecutor<Security>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Security,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Security,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Security,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Security>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Security,Integer>, SecurityCurrencypairJpaRepository<Security>, SecurityJpaRepositoryCustom, UpdateCreateJpaRepository<Security>
public interface SecurityJpaRepository extends SecurityCurrencypairJpaRepository<Security>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaSpecificationExecutor<Security>, SecurityJpaRepositoryCustom, UpdateCreateJpaRepository<Security>
Spring Data JPA repository for managing Security entities

  • Method Details

    • deleteUpdateHistoryQuality

      void deleteUpdateHistoryQuality()
      Executes the `deleteUpdateHistoryQuality` stored procedure to refresh the historyquote_quality metrics for all securities.

      This procedure clears existing quality records and regenerates completeness and creation‐type statistics (missing days, connectorCreated, manualImported, etc.) along with quality percentages based on current historyquote data. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}:contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

    • findByIdSecuritycurrency

      @EntityGraph(value="graph.security.historyquote", type=FETCH) Security findByIdSecuritycurrency(Integer idSecuritycurrency)
      Specified by:
      findByIdSecuritycurrency in interface SecurityCurrencypairJpaRepository<Security>

    • findByIdTenantPrivateIsNullOrIdTenantPrivateAndIdSecuritycurrency

      @Query("SELECT s FROM Security s WHERE s.idSecuritycurrency = ?1 AND (s.idTenantPrivate IS NULL OR s.idTenantPrivate = ?2)") Security findByIdTenantPrivateIsNullOrIdTenantPrivateAndIdSecuritycurrency(Integer idSecuritycurrency, Integer idTenantPrivate)
      Retrieves a Security by its ID only if it is publicly accessible or belongs to the specified tenant.

      The query selects a Security where:

      • idSecuritycurrency matches the given ID, and
      • idTenantPrivate is null (public) or equals the provided tenantPrivate ID.
      Parameters:
      idSecuritycurrency - the identifier of the Security to retrieve
      idTenantPrivate - the tenant ID for private securities (ignored for public securities)
      Returns:
      the matching Security entity, or null if no accessible security is found

    • findWithConnectorByIdTenantAndIdWatchlistWhenRetryIntraGreaterThan0

      @Query("SELECT s FROM Watchlist w JOIN w.securitycurrencyList s\nWHERE w.idTenant = ?1 AND w.idWatchlist = ?2 AND s.retryIntraLoad > 0 AND s.activeToDate >= CURDATE()\nAND s.idConnectorIntra IS NOT NULL") List<Security> findWithConnectorByIdTenantAndIdWatchlistWhenRetryIntraGreaterThan0(Integer idTenant, Integer idWatchlist)
      Finds active securities in the given watchlist that have experienced failed intraday price loads and still have a configured intraday connector (e.g., Yahoo Finance).

      Filters for:

      • retryIntraLoad > 0: one or more previous failures to fetch intraday prices
      • activeToDate ≥ today: security is still active
      • idConnectorIntra is not null: a valid external intraday price connector is configured
      Parameters:
      idTenant - the tenant ID owning the watchlist
      idWatchlist - the watchlist ID
      Returns:
      a list of Security entities that need intraday price reload attempts

    • findDerivedByIdTenantAndIdWatchlistWhenRetryIntraGreaterThan0

      @Query("SELECT s FROM Watchlist w JOIN w.securitycurrencyList s\nWHERE w.idTenant = ?1 AND w.idWatchlist = ?2 AND s.retryIntraLoad > 0\nAND s.activeToDate >= CURDATE() AND s.idLinkSecuritycurrency IS NOT NULL") List<Security> findDerivedByIdTenantAndIdWatchlistWhenRetryIntraGreaterThan0(Integer idTenant, Integer idWatchlist)
      Finds derived securities (those linked via idLinkSecuritycurrency) in the specified watchlist that have experienced failed intraday price loads and are still active.

      A “derived” security is one whose price is computed from another security via a formula (idLinkSecuritycurrency not null). This query selects only those entries where:

      • retryIntraLoad > 0: at least one previous failure to fetch intraday prices
      • activeToDate ≥ today: the security is not yet deactivated
      These derived securities will need recalculation once their base security prices are available.
      Parameters:
      idTenant - the tenant ID owning the watchlist
      idWatchlist - the watchlist ID
      Returns:
      a list of derived Security entities pending intraday price recalculation

    • findDerivedEmptyHistoryquoteByMaxRetryHistoryLoad

      @Query("SELECT s FROM Security s WHERE s.idLinkSecuritycurrency IS NOT NULL\nAND s.retryHistoryLoad < ?1 AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT h FROM s.historyquoteList h)") List<Security> findDerivedEmptyHistoryquoteByMaxRetryHistoryLoad(short retryHistoryLoad)
      Retrieves all derived securities (i.e., those whose prices are computed from another security) that have not yet loaded any historical quotes and have retryHistoryLoad below the specified threshold.

      Filters for:

      • `idLinkSecuritycurrency` is not null: security is derived from another security
      • `retryHistoryLoad invalid input: '<' retryHistoryLoad`: has remaining retry attempts
      • no entries in `historyquoteList`: history quotes have not been loaded
      Parameters:
      retryHistoryLoad - the maximum retryHistoryLoad value; only securities with a lower count are returned
      Returns:
      a list of derived Security entities pending their first history quote load

    • findByIdTenantAndIdWatchlistWhenRetryHistroyGreaterThan0

      @Query("SELECT s as securityCurrency, MAX(h.date) AS date FROM Watchlist w JOIN w.securitycurrencyList s JOIN s.historyquoteList h\nWHERE w.idTenant = ?1 AND w.idWatchlist = ?2 AND s.retryHistoryLoad > 0 AND s.activeToDate >= h.date\nAND s.idConnectorHistory IS NOT NULL GROUP BY s.idSecuritycurrency HAVING s.activeToDate > MAX(h.date)") List<SecurityCurrencyMaxHistoryquoteData<Security>> findByIdTenantAndIdWatchlistWhenRetryHistroyGreaterThan0(Integer idTenant, Integer idWatchlist)
      Retrieves the most recent history quote date for each security in the specified watchlist that has pending historical-reload failures and an active history connector.

      Filters for:

      • retryHistoryLoad > 0: one or more failed history-load attempts
      • activeToDate ≥ quote date: security still active at the time of its latest quote
      • idConnectorHistory not null: a configured external history connector
      Results are grouped by security and include only those with at least one quote.
      Parameters:
      idTenant - the tenant ID owning the watchlist
      idWatchlist - the watchlist ID
      Returns:
      a list of SecurityCurrencyMaxHistoryquoteData projections containing each Security and its latest history-quote date

    • getTradableSecuritiesByTenantAndIdWatschlist

      @Query("SELECT s FROM Watchlist w JOIN w.securitycurrencyList s\nWHERE w.idTenant = ?1 AND w.idWatchlist = ?2 AND s.assetClass.specialInvestmentInstrument <> 10 ORDER BY s.name") List<Security> getTradableSecuritiesByTenantAndIdWatschlist(Integer idTenant, Integer idWatchlist)
      Retrieves all tradable securities in the specified watchlist for a tenant.

      Filters for:

      • Watchlist belonging to the given tenant (idTenant) and watchlist ID (idWatchlist).
      • Securities whose special investment instrument is not NON_INVESTABLE_INDICES (10).
      Results are ordered by the security name.
      Parameters:
      idTenant - the tenant ID owning the watchlist
      idWatchlist - the watchlist ID
      Returns:
      a list of Security entities that are tradable within the watchlist

    • getMaxHistoryquoteWithConnector

      @Query("SELECT s as securityCurrency, MAX(h.date) AS date FROM Security s JOIN s.historyquoteList h\nWHERE s.retryHistoryLoad < ?1 AND s.idConnectorHistory IS NOT NULL GROUP BY h.idSecuritycurrency\nHAVING s.activeToDate > MAX(h.date) ORDER BY s.idSecuritycurrency") List<SecurityCurrencyMaxHistoryquoteData<Security>> getMaxHistoryquoteWithConnector(short maxHistoryRetry)
      Retrieves the most recent history-quote date for each active Security that has a configured history connector and remaining retry attempts below the specified threshold.

      - Filters for Security entities where retryHistoryLoad < maxHistoryRetry and idConnectorHistory is not null. - Joins to historyquoteList to find the maximum quote date per security. - Includes only securities still active at their latest quote date (activeToDate ≥ MAX(h.date)). - Orders results by security ID. With or without this clause "ORDER BY s.idSecuritycurrency" we get more rows than without it. Why?

      Parameters:
      maxHistoryRetry - the upper limit for retryHistoryLoad; securities with lower values are included
      Returns:
      a list of SecurityCurrencyMaxHistoryquoteData projections, each containing a Security and its latest quote date

    • getMaxHistoryquoteWithCalculation

      @Query("SELECT s as securityCurrency, MAX(h.date) AS date FROM Security s JOIN s.historyquoteList h\nWHERE s.retryHistoryLoad < ?1 AND s.idLinkSecuritycurrency IS NOT NULL GROUP BY h.idSecuritycurrency\nHAVING s.activeToDate > MAX(h.date) ORDER BY s.idSecuritycurrency") List<SecurityCurrencyMaxHistoryquoteData<Security>> getMaxHistoryquoteWithCalculation(short maxHistoryRetry)
      Retrieves the latest history-quote date for each formula-derived security (where idLinkSecuritycurrency is not null) that still has retry attempts remaining.
      Parameters:
      maxHistoryRetry - maximum retryHistoryLoad value allowed
      Returns:
      list of projections pairing each derived security with its most recent quote date

    • hasSecurityTransaction

      @Query(value="SELECT IF(EXISTS(SELECT * FROM transaction t WHERE t.id_securitycurrency=?1) = 1, \'true\', \'false\' ); ", nativeQuery=true) boolean hasSecurityTransaction(Integer idSecuritycurency)
      Checks whether any transactions exist for the specified security.

      Executes a native SQL EXISTS query to determine if at least one transaction references the given security ID.

      Parameters:
      idSecuritycurrency - the ID of the security to check
      Returns:
      true if one or more transactions exist for the security; false otherwise

    • getMaxHistoryquoteWithConnectorForExchange

      @Query(nativeQuery=false) List<SecurityCurrencyMaxHistoryquoteData<Security>> getMaxHistoryquoteWithConnectorForExchange(short maxHistoryRetry, List<Integer> idsStockexchange)
      Finds the latest history quote date for each active Security in the given exchanges that has a configured history connector and whose retryHistoryLoad is below the threshold.

      Uses JPQL to select Security entities with retryHistoryLoad invalid input: '<' maxHistoryRetry, idConnectorHistory not null, and stockexchange ID in idsStockexchange, grouping by security.

      Parameters:
      maxHistoryRetry - maximum allowed retryHistoryLoad before exclusion
      idsStockexchange - list of stock exchange IDs to include
      Returns:
      a list of projections containing each Security and its most recent quote date

    • getPossibleMissingDivInterestByFrequency

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<SecurityJpaRepository.CheckSecurityTransIntegrity> getPossibleMissingDivInterestByFrequency()
      A new payment of interest or dividend is expected: - Last payment with this client plus the addition of days determined based on the frequency of payments. Instruments with entries in the Dividend entity that have a payment date are ignored.
      TODO First interest of a bond determined on the basis of the trading date plus addition of the frequency.

    • getPossibleMissingDividentsByDividendTable

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<SecurityJpaRepository.CheckSecurityTransIntegrity> getPossibleMissingDividentsByDividendTable(int daysLookBack, int acceptDaysAroundPayDate)
      If an instrument was held during the period of a dividend payment, the dividend entity is used to determine whether there is a corresponding dividend transaction. The payment date of the dividend is used.
      Parameters:
      daysLookBack - Number of days in the past that are checked from the current date.
      acceptDaysAroundPayDate - There may be certain differences between the transaction date and the official dividend payment date. This indicates the number of days for this tolerance.

    • getHoldingsOfInactiveSecurties

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<SecurityJpaRepository.CheckSecurityTransIntegrity> getHoldingsOfInactiveSecurties()
      Retrieves securities that are still held by tenants but have become inactive (active_to_date before today) and have not yet triggered a notification.
      Returns:
      a list of CheckSecurityTransIntegrity projection

    • getUnusedSecurityForAlgo

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<Security> getUnusedSecurityForAlgo(Integer idTenantPrivate, Integer idAlgoAssetclassSecurity)
      Lists securities eligible for assignment to an algorithmic asset‐class that are not yet part of the specified algo_assetclass_security and match the tenant’s private flag.
      Parameters:
      idTenantPrivate - tenant-private ID filter (nullable)
      idAlgoAssetclassSecurity - the algorithmic asset‐class ID
      Returns:
      a list of Securities available for the given algo_assetclass

    • getHistoryquoteQualityConnectorFlat

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) Stream<IHistoryquoteQualityFlat> getHistoryquoteQualityConnectorFlat()
      Streams flat projections of historyquote quality metrics grouped by connector. Each projection includes connector ID, stockexchange name and ID, category type, special investment instrument, counts of securities, active securities, and aggregated create_type counts, plus average qualityPercentage.
      Returns:
      a stream of IHistoryquoteQualityFlat projections for connector-level quality

    • getHistoryquoteQualityStockexchangeFlat

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) Stream<IHistoryquoteQualityFlat> getHistoryquoteQualityStockexchangeFlat()
      Streams flat projections of historyquote quality metrics grouped by stockexchange. Each projection includes stockexchange ID and name, connector ID, category type, special investment instrument, counts of securities, active securities, aggregated create_type counts, plus average qualityPercentage.
      Returns:
      a stream of IHistoryquoteQualityFlat projections for exchange-level quality

    • getAllTaskDataChangeSecurityCurrencyPairInfoWithId

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) Stream<IdSecurityCurrencyPairInfo> getAllTaskDataChangeSecurityCurrencyPairInfoWithId()
      Streams security‐currency tooltip data for pending task_data_change entries. Each projection contains the securitycurrency ID and a display tooltip (name, ticker, ISIN or from/to pair).
      Returns:
      a stream of IdSecurityCurrencyPairInfo projections for task notifications

    • getHistoryquoteQualityByIds

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<IHistoryquoteQualityWithSecurityProp> getHistoryquoteQualityByIds(String idConnectorHistory, Integer idStockexchange, Byte categoryType, Byte specialInvestmentInstrument)
      Retrieves detailed historyquote quality entries for securities matching the given connector, exchange, assetclass category, and special investment instrument.
      Parameters:
      idConnectorHistory - connector identifier
      idStockexchange - stock exchange ID
      categoryType - asset class category type
      specialInvestmentInstrument - special investment instrument code
      Returns:
      a list of IHistoryquoteQualityWithSecurityProp projections with security properties

    • getBySecurityDerivedLinkByIdSecurityLink

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<IFormulaSecurityLoad> getBySecurityDerivedLinkByIdSecurityLink(Integer idLinkSecuritycurrency)
      Retrieves load formulas and link IDs for derived securities based on a parent security link.
      Parameters:
      idLinkSecuritycurrency - the parent securitycurrency ID
      Returns:
      a list of IFormulaSecurityLoad projections with split/formula data

    • getSecurityYearCloseDivSum

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<SecurityYearClose> getSecurityYearCloseDivSum(Integer idSecurity)
      Retrieves year-end close price and annual dividend sum per year for the given security.
      Parameters:
      idSecurity - the securitycurrency ID
      Returns:
      a list of SecurityYearClose projections with date (year-end), securityClose, and yearDiv

    • getSecurityYearDivSumCurrencyClose

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<SecurityYearClose> getSecurityYearDivSumCurrencyClose(Integer idSecurity, Integer idCurrencypair)
      Retrieves year-end close price, annual dividend sum, and corresponding currency-pair close for the given security and currency pair.
      Parameters:
      idSecurity - the securitycurrency ID for dividends
      idCurrencypair - the currency-pair ID for currencyClose
      Returns:
      a list of SecurityYearClose projections with date, securityClose, yearDiv, and currencyClose

    • getFailedHistoryConnector

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<SecurityJpaRepository.MonitorFailedConnector> getFailedHistoryConnector(LocalDate dateBackAfter, int retry, int percentageFailed)
      Counts all working and non-functioning historical price data connectors, grouped by connector. Security and currency pair connectors are taken into account. Only securities after a certain date are taken into account when counting non-functioning ones.
      Parameters:
      dateBackAfter - Securities are taken into account for the count of non-functioning ones if their most recent historical price data is younger than this date.
      retry - Instruments are included in the count of non-functioning instruments if the repetition counter is equal to or greater than this value.
      percentageFailed - The result set contains the connector if this percentage value of non-functioning connectors exceeds this value.
      Returns:
      a list of MonitorFailedConnector

    • getFailedIntradayConnector

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<SecurityJpaRepository.MonitorFailedConnector> getFailedIntradayConnector(LocalDate dateBackOrRetry, int retry, int percentageFailed)
      Counts all working and non-functioning intraday connectors. Both securities and currency pairs are taken into account.
      Parameters:
      dateBackOrRetry - In addition to checking the repeat counter overrun, the date of the most recent update can also be checked. The date given here must be older than that of the instrument, otherwise it will be evaluated as non-functioning.
      retry - Instruments are included in the count of non-functioning instruments if the repetition counter is equal to or greater than this value.
      percentageFailed - The result set contains the connector if this percentage value of non-functioning connectors exceeds this value.

    • calcGainLossBasedOnDateOrNewestPrice

      void calcGainLossBasedOnDateOrNewestPrice(List<SecurityPositionSummary> securitycurrencyPositionSummary, Date untilDate)
      Description copied from interface: SecurityJpaRepositoryCustom
      Calculates gain/loss for a list of security positions based on a specified date or the newest price.
      Specified by:
      calcGainLossBasedOnDateOrNewestPrice in interface SecurityJpaRepositoryCustom
      Parameters:
      securitycurrencyPositionSummary - A list of security position summaries.
      untilDate - The date until which to calculate the gain/loss. If null, the newest price is used.
